thread.title: Video: Paddleboarding down river in Sumba, Indonesia
thread.title_full: Video: Paddleboarding down river in Sumba, Indonesia - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Video: Paddleboarding down river in Sumba, Indonesia
text: Stand up paddleboarding (SUP) requires you to maintain an upright postion while wending your way gently along the surface of a body of water. Failing that you can just sit down, watch the scenery and let the current take you. But watch out for buffalo. The above timelapse footage shows guests at the luxury resort of Nihiwatu on the wild island of Sumba, in Indonesia, paddleboarding down river towards the coast. Natalie Paris, who visited the resort recently, said: "After a couple of tight bends, the river became lackadaisical and a gentle paddle was all it took to scoot past men fishing, children shouting and waving, and the odd buffalo glaring from out of the water." The island of Sumba is just an hour's flight from Bali but is an unspoilt paradise with a fascinating tribal culture that is only just starting to be properly explored.
